data.name: Google Solution Challenge 2023: Kick-Off Event
data.description:
Hello everyone!😄


The Google Solution Challenge 2023 is fast approaching, and we would like to invite you to attend our kick-off event.


Google Solution Challenge is a competition organized by Google where participants work together to find solutions to real-world problems. The challenge involves problem-solving, collaboration, and critical thinking, providing a platform for students to showcase their skills and creativity. The challenge encourages participants to think outside the box and find innovative solutions to complex problems. 


Whether you're studying computer science, engineering, or any other discipline, we welcome you to come and learn more about this exciting opportunity.


If you don't have a team, don't worry! We will help you find members for your team. This event is an excellent opportunity to network and make new connections.


Date: 7th February
Time: 4-6 PM 
Location: MacRobert Building, Room 113


We kindly ask you to check in for the event through the following link: https://gdsc.community.dev/e/m9xreu/. This will ensure a smooth and organized event and keep you informed of any possible changes.


If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to reach out.


See you there!👋


#DeveloperStudentClubs
#googledevelopers #universityofaberdeen
#googlestudents #google #dsc #programmers #android #aberdeen #uni #student #scotland #googlesolutionchallange

data.name: INDUCTION 2023
data.description:
Hey University of Aberdeen students! 😄


Are you ready to take your tech skills to the next level? 👀 


Join the Google Developer Student Club (GDSC) at the University of Aberdeen and be a part of a community of like-minded students who are passionate about technology and innovation. Our community-driven program offers opportunities to learn new skills, connect with industry professionals, and build projects to showcase your abilities.


Don't miss our induction event happening on January 31st at MacRobert 250 from 4-5 PM. This will be a short introductory event for interested students to learn more about our society.


Throughout the semester, we have exciting plans such as participation in the Google Solution Challenge, where students work on teams to develop and present a software solution to a real-world problem. Successful participants can win cash prizes or even a trip to the Google headquarters in the US. We also have guest talks from professionals in different tech- and business-related industries and regular social events to foster a community and create an opportunity for networking. 😊


Sign up through our link, so you can get informed of any changes and notified before the event:https://gdsc.community.dev/e/mwct59/


If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to reach out.


Join us and be part of a community of students who are shaping the future of technology. ❤️


See you at our induction event! 👋


#DeveloperStudentClubs
#googledevelopers #universityofaberdeen
#googlestudents #google #dsc #programmers #android #aberdeen 	#uni #student #scotland

data.name: Tic-Tac-Toe & Deployment
data.description:
Hello developers!😄

The last event of the Web Dev workshop is here! Before we present the agenda for this event, we would like to thank everyone for their participation, it's been a pleasure delivering this workshop and we hope that you've gained some valuable skills that you'll be able to use in the future. Of course, this doesn't mean we don't have planned other workshops for you! Keep an eye on our social media to make sure you don't miss any announcements.👀

In the final session, we'll continue with our tic-tac-toe game and add more functionalities to it. You'll be able to work on solutions that help determine the winner of the game. We'll end the workshop by showing you how to publish a website so you'll be able to start and deploy your own projects! 

The last session will be held on the 21st of November, at 5:30 PM in MacRobert Building, room MR117.

Sign up through our link, so you can get informed of any changes and notified before the event:https://gdsc.community.dev/e/mpha4t/

Delivered by Darius Dragnea and Erik Staas.❤️

If you have any questions, feel free to contact us on our social media pages.

See you there!😊

#DeveloperStudentClubs
#googledevelopers #universityofaberdeen
#googlestudents

data.name: React: Tic-Tac-Toe
data.description:
Hello developers! 😊

The sixth event of the Web Dev workshop is here! In this session, you'll get to apply all of the previous knowledge you gained to build your own tic-tac-toe game. This will further improve your understanding of React and its syntax. We'll also talk more about the previous elements discussed, hooks and props.

The 6th session will be held on the 14th of November, at 5:30 PM in MacRobert Building, room MR117.

Sign up through our link, so you can get informed of any changes and notified before the event: https://gdsc.community.dev/e/m6z2c5/

Delivered by Darius Dragnea and Erik Staas.❤️

If you have any questions, feel free to contact us on our social media pages.

See you there!😄

#DeveloperStudentClubs
#googledevelopers #universityofaberdeen
#googlestudents

data.name: Build in React
data.description:
Hello developers! 😊

The fifth event of the Web Dev workshop is here! We want to apologise for the last week. We hope that it didn't cause a significant disruption in your schedule. In this session, we'll show you how to build your own interactive tic-tac-toe game so that you can better understand React and its syntax. We'll also look at one of the most important aspects of every app: State Management. As your app grows, it's crucial to know how your state is organised and how the data flows through different components. This will help build applications that look better and have a friendlier UI.

The 5th session will be held on the 7th of November, at 5:30 PM in MacRobert Building, room MR117.

Sign up through our link, so you can get informed of any changes and notified before the event: https://gdsc.community.dev/e/mg3jwu/

Delivered by Darius Dragnea and Erik Staas.❤️

If you have any questions, feel free to contact us on our social media pages.

See you there!😄

#DeveloperStudentClubs
#googledevelopers #universityofaberdeen
#googlestudents

data.name: Practice in React
data.description:
Hello everyone!👋

We are here with the fourth event of the Web Development workshop! In this session, we'll introduce hooks, components and props. We'll talk about their importance in React and why they can help you build a great application. You'll practice these elements through a series of exercises, and at the end, you can ask any questions you might have.

The 4th session will be held on the 24th of October, at 5:30 PM in MacRobert Building, room MR317.

Sign up through our link so you can get informed of any changes and notified before the event: https://gdsc.community.dev/e/m8p8fa/

Delivered by Darius Dragnea and Erik Staas.❤️

Note: We kindly ask you to bring your own laptop since the room is not equipped with computers.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact us on our social media pages.

See you there!

#DeveloperStudentClubs
#googledevelopers #universityofaberdeen
#googlestudents

data.name: Intro to React + Social
data.description:
Hello everyone!👋

The third event of the Web Development workshop is here! In this session, we'll start by looking into the thought process of building an application in React. We will examine a component's role in a React application and help you code your first React component. At the end, Darius and Erik will host a Q&A session in which you can ask any question that you might have.

We have also planned a social after the event! So if you have some extra time and want to detach from uni work for a bit, feel free to join us.

The 3rd session will be held on the 17th of October, at 5:30 PM in MacRobert Building, room MR317.

Sign up through our link so you can get informed of any changes and notified before the event: https://gdsc.community.dev/e/mmva3w/

data.name: JavaScript Basics
data.description:
Hello everyone!👋

We are ready to announce the next event of the Web Development workshop. First, we want to say that we are grateful to everyone who attended the previous session!🤗 We hope you've learned something new and that you found the material interesting.☺️ Next week's session will focus on the basics of JavaScript. You'll learn about variables, functions, loops and much more! Darius and Erik will also go into how you can add interactivity to your online portfolio. At the end, there will be a Q&A session where you can ask any questions that you might have.

The 2nd session will be held on the 10th of October, at 5:30 PM in MacRobert Building, room MR317.

data.name: Intro to HTML, CSS and JavaScript
data.description:
Hello everyone!🤗

Our first workshop of the year is finally here!✨🎉 In this workshop, you'll learn the fundamentals of HTML, CSS and JavaScript. You're not required to have any prior programming knowledge! Everything will be taught from an entry-level perspective and you'll have to opportunity to obtain hands-on experience through exercises. 

The workshop will be held on the 3rd of October, at 5:30 PM in MacRobert Building, room MR317. 

Sign up through the link so you can get informed of any changes and notified before the event: https://gdsc.community.dev/e/mvfjtb/

data.name: INFO SESSION + SOCIAL
data.description:
Hey everyone!
Want to know more about what's like to be a member of the GDSC University of Aberdeen? Join us for this info session where you'll have the opportunity to meet some of the core-team members and learn more about what events we have prepared for you this year. We have also planned a social afterwards so we can get to know you better.

The info session will be hosted this Wednesday 28th at 5 PM in MacRobert Building, room MR266. We can't wait to see you there.

Sign up through the link so you can get informed of any changes and notified before the event: https://gdsc.community.dev/e/m6m6s5/

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

We are looking for a new core-team member to occupy the Fresher representative role. If you're a first-year student and an outgoing person this role might just be for you. If you're interested in this position, please address one of the core-team members during the event.

data.name: Programming with Python | with Developer's Club and AIESEC in Aberdeen
data.description:
Have you always been interested in programming but didn't know how to start learning it?
We have found the perfect solution for this!

AIESEC in Aberdeen has partnered with The Developer Student Club at the University of Aberdeen, to bring you a series of three workshops about the basics of Python Programming.

Python is the fastest-growing programming language today and is seen to be one of the most attractive skills for employers in most industries.
Thank you to everyone who attended our previous workshops! This Thursday we'll present our last session, during which the following topics will be covered:
- Data Visualisation with Pandas and Matplotlib
- Stock Market Analysis

📍The event will be held on the 2nd of December, 5PM in Macrobert Building, Room MR051 in the Old Aberdeen Campus.
No experience is needed!
Bring your laptops 💻 to the event so you can practice as well!
To sign-up for the session and keep our attendance numbers in check, please complete the following form: https://forms.gle/zMhp5iETRKtNnaA18

After the event we'll also have a social at 7PM, so don't hesitate and join us for some fun!

data.name: Social event

data.name: Python Essentials for Business IV
data.description:
Hey everyone!☺️
Continuing our Python series, our fourth workshop will be taking place on Wednesday the 31st at 5pm as usual. In this workshop a stock market analysis will be carried out where we will plot data using MatPlotLib and Yahoo Finance Libraries, and live coding will once again be included!💻

The workshop will start off with a short recap of our last two workshops and then we will delve into how to plot data directly from a pandas dataframe into MatPlotLib. By plotting, we can place data into a visual context in order to identify patterns, trends and correlations, which is highly useful in a business context. Furthermore, in the workshop we will compare data offered by different stock data providers such as Google, Apple and Microsoft. 

This workshop is also utilising google collab for better data visualization, the link to it is posted below. To access this coding environment please make sure that you have a gmail account or make one before the workshop as it is really worth it!
If you did not join our past two workshops, don’t worry! The short recap in the beginning will inform you about what we have already learned and you can ask us questions any time before, during, or after the event.🤗

We’re looking forward to seeing you there!
Love, EBS and DSC

https://colab.research.google.com/notebooks/intro.ipynb

data.name: Python Essentials For Business III
data.description:
Hey everyone! 😊

Continuing our Python series, our third workshop will be taking place on Wednesday the 24th at 5pm as usual. This workshop will be about data analysis with python’s library pandas and it will once again include live coding!

We will start with a short recap of our last two workshops and then we will go explore Data Frames in pandas and show you how to manipulate data from CSV files by using data frames. We will be using google collab in this workshop for better data visualization, the link to it is posted below. To access this coding environment please make sure that you have a gmail account, or make one before the workshop as it is really worth it! 

If you did not join our past two workshops, don’t worry! The short recap in the beginning will inform you about what we have already learned and you can ask us questions any time before, during, or after the event. 

We’re looking forward to seeing you there!
Love, EBS and DSC

https://colab.research.google.com/notebooks/intro.ipynb

data.name: Python Essentials For Business II
data.description:
Hey everyone!!😊

On Wednesday the 10th of March, we will be hosting the second event of the Python Essentials for Business series together with Developer Student Club❗️

We will start off the second workshop with a recap from last time and subsequently delve into Python Collections, which refers to “containers” that store different types of information.
Moreover, we will go over Python libraries and show you how to read data from files with Python💻

Sounds exciting right? 🤗

As requested last time, the presenters will do live coding, which will make it easier for you to follow and learn throughout the whole session!✨

You just need to access the following link during the event and start your journey with Python😃
https://repl.it/?fbclid=IwAR2C6Df2B4VWYwfQUTCZEcF8nxiD24Q-IBRr0Q9dibPUl-dgCqIiukAcwWE 

We hope to see you all on Wednesday!☺️

data.name: Python Essentials for Business
data.description:
Hey everyone!😊

EBS and the Developer Student Club Aberdeen are partnering up and offering you an exciting event series about Python Essentials for Business❗️

Python is the fastest growing programming language today, and is seen to be one of the most attractive skills for employers in business and finance. 

Our first workshop will cover the basics of python. We will talk about programming - how does it work? What are the basic constructors to realise a simple program? 

If you would like to learn more about this please join us and feel free to ask any questions that you might have! 😄


We hope to see you there!✨

data.name: 2021 Solution Challenge Kick Off
data.description:
Hi developers! 😀

We hope you have all had a wonderful break! ☺️
To start this new year, Google has organised the 2021 Solution Challenge Kick Off💡. 

This event will include:
-🏆 Overview of the challenge
-🌎 Introduction of the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDG)
-🏢What Google does for them 
-🙋 Q/A

The event will be hosted by 6 speakers: 
➡️Erica Hanson, Global DSC Program Lead at Google
➡️Arman Hezarkhani, CEO and Founder at Parthean
➡️Victor Serrat, Technical Lead at UNICEF
➡️Yossi Matias, VP Engineering and Head of Israel Eng Center at Google
➡️Maria Rabinovich, Founder and Managing Director at Flare
➡️Caitlin Dolkart, Co-founder & Managing Director at Flare

If you are interested and you want to use your skills to build something with a real world impact, join us on 20th January at 3.30 PM 🙂.

data.name: A Cloud Native Discussion with Googlers
data.description:
Hi developers :)! 

On the 9th of December we will have an event organised by Google Developers in collaboration between all DSCs across the UK and Ireland. 

This event is a discussion with 2 Googlers who will cover topics about the Google Cloud Platform.

To take part into this great opportunity, use the link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pgpW-1C6MDA&feature=youtu.be

And register here please :) : https://dsc.community.dev/events/details/developer-student-clubs-university-of-aberdeen-presents-a-cloud-native-discussion-with-googlers

data.name: Web Development - Create your Personal Website
data.description:
Hello Everyone!📣

We are starting our workshop series by covering an introduction to web development. During this workshop you will learn how to build your own personal website 👩‍💻👨‍💻. This can come in handy if you want a virtual portfolio to showcase your talents or create your own blog among other things. 

The event is open to everyone, regardless of your knowledge of web development. Feel free to join even if you have absolutely no prior knowledge of programming as our team will explain starting from the basics of programming. 

🔔So if you are interested, join us on 30th November @6.30PM on MS teams.

You can join the event through this link: https://dsc.community.dev/j/weynjgn5xf8yq/

data.name: Info Session
data.description:
Hellooo everyone! :)

Developer Student Club is welcoming everyone to our first info session, no matter your background, what you are studying. 

All of our events don't require any previous experience!

During the info session, we will talk about: 
- Core Team Presentation
